intro: Pasania ducampii, commonly known as the African violet, is a flowering plant native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its velvety, waxy leaves and showy, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows as a perennial herb, often forming a compact rosette of foliage. Its flowers are usually pink, purple, or white, and bloom in spring and summer. Pasania ducampii is popular as a houseplant due to its attractive appearance and relatively easy care requirements.
